title: Wilson is Giants' starting QB, coach Daboll says
content: Russell Wilson is the clear-cut starting quarterback as the Giants begin training camp, coach Brian Daboll said Wednesday.

title: Westwood slams rankings system as 'mockery'
content: Lee Westwood became the latest LIV Golf player to criticize the world golf ranking system, calling it a "mockery."

title: Tua: Hill working to regain trust of Fins players
content: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa said Wednesday that Tyreek Hill is putting in the work to rebuild trust with his teammates after his comments in last season's final game.

title: Burrow: Bengals' contract trouble 'disappointing'
content: For yet another year, the Bengals are trying to navigate around contract issues as they prepare for the start of the upcoming season, a situation that Joe Burrow called "obviously disappointing."

title: FSU QB Castellanos standing firm on Bama jab
content: New Florida State QB Tommy Castellanos, who took a perceived shot at Alabama, the Seminoles' Week 1 opponent, says he meant "no disrespect" to the Tide but stands on his comments.

title: Oregon's Lanning: Tighten CFP to wrap by Jan. 1
content: Oregon coach Dan Lanning is advocating for college football to adopt an NFL-style schedule with limited open weeks, no long layoffs for playoff teams and a season that wraps on Jan. 1.

title: Eagles vets bristle at 'defending champions' label
content: The Eagles enter the 2025 campaign hyper-focused on turning the page from their Super Bowl run last season, to the point where terms such as "defending champs" and "repeat" are being left on the cutting-room floor.

title: Jags plan to 'flip-flop' Hunter on offense, defense
content: The Jaguars are have a plan in place that will eventually allow receiver/cornerback Travis Hunter to "flip-flop" between offense and defense in the same practice during training camp, according to coach Liam Coen.

title: NBA rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
content: Is Dallas' rebuild already complete? How close is San Antonio? We examine the paths forward for 14 teams that missed the playoffs.

title: The worst decision every NBA team has made over the past five years, ranked 30 to 1
content: Zach Kram examines the deals, trades and picks that all 30 NBA teams would like to take back from the 2020s.

title: Euro 2025 semifinal live updates: Spain vs. Germany
content: Enjoy live updates and instant analysis from the second Euro 2025 semifinal between Spain and Germany

title: Passan's ultimate MLB trade deadline preview: Where all 30 teams stand, best fits and latest intel
content: From the contenders to the rebuilders, here's what every front office is thinking ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves, from Davante Adams to Russell Wilson
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1? Matt Bowen ranks the top 50.

title: Manchester United's U.S. preseason tour: Amorim's goals, players to watch
content: Manchester United and Ruben Amorim have arrived in the U.S. aiming to lay the groundwork for a rebound after a dismal 2024-25 campaign.

title: USMNT prospect Wiley sent on loan to Watford
content: American defender Caleb Wiley was again sent on loan from Chelsea to second-tier Watford on Tuesday after spending the second half of last season with the Hornets.

title: Zubimendi: Liverpool move wasn't at 'right time'
content: Martín Zubimendi has said he turned down Liverpool last summer because "it wasn't the right time" to leave Real Sociedad.

title: Sources: Arsenal remain close to Gyökeres deal
content: Arsenal are edging closer to a deal worth in the region of €73 million ($86m) for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Fabregas: 'Never say never' on Messi, Como move
content: Como boss Cesc Fabregas has said Lionel Messi is happy in U.S but hasn't ruled out the possibility of his former Barcelona teammate signing for the Italian club one day.

title: Source: Leverkusen, Juve chase Chelsea's Sterling
content: Juventus and Bayer Leverkusen are among the clubs interested in Chelsea winger Raheem Sterling, a source has told ESPN.

title: Source: Mbappé to take No. 10 jersey at Madrid
content: Kylian Mbappé will wear the No. 10 jersey at Real Madrid next season, switching from the No. 9 he wore last year, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: MLS All-Star coach hopeful missing Messi plays
content: The 2025 MLS All-Star Game in Austin, Texas, was supposed to be the first featuring Lionel Messi after injury kept him out of the 2024 event. That appeared less likely following Monday's first training session.

title: Jota's wife posts tribute on wedding anniversary
content: The wife of the late Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has posted a "forever" message on social media on what would have been their first month wedding anniversary.

title: What to expect from Ohtani as a pitcher for the rest of 2025
content: Shohei Ohtani has ramped up his workload since making his pitching debut as a Dodger back on June 16, but what can we expect out of him for the rest of the season?

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Scheffler's dominance, players to watch and how the Ryder Cup teams look
content: What's next for Scottie Scheffler? Who are the locks for Bethpage, and who has work to do? Following The Open, we look ahead to the rest of the 2025 golf season.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Jets go high-tech (and old school) with locker room redesign
content: A barbershop, along with customized video screens and lockers give the Jets' new locker room a modern-meets-retro feel.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Buyer beware: The gamble MLS clubs make with designated players
content: The opening of the transfer window on Thursday offers a reminder that signing a big-name player simply won't cut it in MLS these days.

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: The UFC 320 and UFC 321 headliners have been announced. Brett Okamoto reacts to the three upcoming title fights.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Bihar police lathi charge on protesting Jan Suraaj workers in Patna, many get injured
content: Losing cool over police action, party founder Prashant Kishor said he will make it difficult for the government to function even for a day

title: Parliamentary panel faults Centre’s move to disengage 7-decade-old NIRDPR
content: The reputed autonomous organisation has been known for its expertise in building capacities of rural development functionaries, elected representatives, financial institutions and community-based organisations

title: Consider watermelon cultivators’ plea for compensation, Madras High Court directs T.N. govt
content: They claimed to have suffered losses due to a scare created by food safety officials regarding alleged injection of chemicals to enhance colour and sweetness

title: BPCL-KR urged to consider Ayyankuzhi residents’ demand for land acquisition
content: Over 30 families remain sandwiched on a 9.4-acre strip between two major public sector units — Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited and BPCL-KR

title: Sea fury batters Chellanam yet again
content: Worn-out seawall and geobags add to the plight of residents on the 5-km stretch between Puthenthode and Kattikadavu

title: World Food India event to begin on September 25
content: Food processing industry’s concerns about GST imposed on the sector are “right”, says Union Minister for Food Processing Chirag Paswan; promises to be a bridge between industry and GST Council

title: Supreme Court recalls its judgment got by fraud, says deception and justice cannot dwell together
content: Bench invokes inherent powers to annul earlier judgment after finding fraud and suppression of facts by litigant

title: Puja Khedkar’s non-creamy layer OBC certificate cancelled; she launches challenge
content: Her father declared property valued at ₹40 crore in an election affidavit filed during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Over 4.7 lakh pirated NCERT textbooks seized since 2024: Education Ministry tells Rajya Sabha
content: The information was shared by Union Minister of State for Education Jayant Chaudhary in a written reply in the Upper House.

title: J&K leaders demand Statehood, decry Pulwama, Pahalgam ‘security failures’
content: The Assembly elections were held in the Union Territory of J&K in September 2024 but restoration of Statehood, an assurance given by the Union Government to the Supreme Court, is yet to be done

title: ₹29,353 crore spent to upgrade railway infrastructure in Bihar so far, says Vaishnaw
content: The Minister said that Bihar’s railway budget has seen a nine-fold rise in 11 years, and key river bridges such as Munger, Patna and Kosi have been completed

title: ED arrests three in ₹1,000 crore real estate fraud case
content: Promoters of Universal Buildwell accused of diverting funds from homebuyers across eight projects in Gurugram and Faridabad

title: Navy chief hails 100th indigenous ship as symbol of maritime self-reliance
content: Admiral Tripathi spoke of the Indian Navy’s Vision 2047 to transform into an ‘Aatmanirbhar’ force through leadership-driven focus on innovation, indigenisation, and integration of niche, disruptive, and emerging technologies

title: Fixtures Worth Rs 35 Lakh Missing From Kolkata 5-Star Hotel Under Renovation: Cops
content: A theft, involving luxury fittings worth approximately Rs 35 lakh, was reported from a five-star hotel in Kolkata's Esplanade area, currently undergoing some renovation work since last year, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Far Below Survival Needs": WHO Chief On Gaza's 'Mass Starvation'
content: The World Health Organization's chief warned Wednesday of widespread starvation in Gaza, saying food deliveries into the war-ravaged Palestinian territory were "far below what is needed for the survival of the population".

title: "Let's Meet": Sena 'Slapgate' MLA Dares AIMIM Leader After 'Will Beat You' Threat
content: Shiv Sena legislator Sanjay Gaikwad and AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel have engaged in a fresh war of words, taking forward their face-off, which started when the former assaulted an MLA hostel canteen worker in Mumbai earlier this month.

title: 3 Northeast States Issue Alert To Check Illegal Migrants After Assam Eviction Drive
content: Three states in the northeast have issued an alert cautioning against the entry of illegal migrants from Assam, where the Himanta Biswa Sarma government has been carrying out massive eviction drives.

title: Microsoft Server Hack Likely Single Actor, Over 8,000 Firms Hit
content: A global attack on Microsoft server software used by thousands of government agencies and businesses to share documents within organisations is likely the work of a single actor, a cybersecurity researcher said on Monday.

title: Massive Protests Erupt In IIT Guwahati Over 'Exceptionally High' Fee Hike
content: IIT Guwahati students are protesting fee hike. They allege they were promised a revision in hike but nothing happened and on Tuesday, the day of registration for the July-November semester, the students were forced to pay fee.

title: Israel Denies Causing 'Mass Starvation' In Gaza
content: Israel on Wednesday hit back at growing international criticism that it was behind chronic food shortages in Gaza, instead accusing Hamas of deliberately creating a humanitarian crisis in the Palestinian territory.

title: Woman Searched "How To Kill" On Internet Before Killing Husband: Cops
content: A 25-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her husband in Delhi's Nihal Vihar, with the police en route to Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly to question his cousin over a suspected extramarital affair, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Highlights: 6 Bills Listed In Parliament, Opposition Demands Bihar Roll Revision Debate
content: Time allotted for discussion on Operation Sindoor will be extended by nine hours. The debate is expected to remain a focal point as the House grapples with multiple contentious issues.

title: What To Know About The US Decision To Leave UNESCO, Why It Matters
content: With the support of international partners and the mobilization of $115 million, the UN cultural agency UNESCO recently helped rebuild the Iraqi city of Mosul after it was devastated by the Islamic State group.

title: 'Processed Food Is Not Bad': Union Minister Chirag Paswan
content: Union Food Processing Minister Chirag Paswan on Wednesday stressed the need to correct the false narrative that processed food is bad for health.

title: Exclusive: Blank Papers, Multiple Credits - Manipur's Multi-Crore Highway Compensation Mystery
content: People affected by three ongoing highway widening projects in Manipur's Kangpokpi district have alleged an insurgent group forced them to sign on blank papers to take a cut from their compensation money.

title: Centre In Huddle To Regain Lost Ground On Judge's Impeachment: Sources
content: Two days after the resignation of Jagdish Dhankhar from the post of the Vice President, the government is brainstorming ways to undo the damage he caused by accepting the Opposition notice for the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma

title: 'Can Stay In Matrimonial Home': Court Relief For Widow Thrown Out By In-Laws
content: Delhi's Karkardooma court has recently, in a Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act case, granted liberty to a widow to reside in the matrimonial home along with her minor child.

title: 4 Al-Qaeda Terrorists Arrested In Gujarat, They Used Auto-Delete App
content: Four terrorists linked to al-Qaeda involved in running a fake currency racket and spreading the global terror group's ideology have been arrested by the Gujarat anti-terrorist squad (ATS). One of them was arrested from another state, the ATS said.

title: Rolls-Royce Cars Of Bollywood Actors Fined 38 Lakhs. There's A 'KGF' Twist
content: Two Rolls-Royce cars, each registered in the names of two Bollywood superstars, were fined more than 18 lakh and nearly 20 lakh, respectively, for failing to pay road tax in the capital city of Karnataka.

title: 'Hottest In The Room': Trump Praises Intelligence Chief Gabbard Over 2016 Election Rigging Report
content: At a recent White House event, US President Donald Trump caused fresh controversy by praising Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard as "the hottest one in the room".

title: 3 Killed, 1 Injured In Northern Ireland Shooting
content: A shooting in a rural area of Northern Ireland left two people dead and two others seriously wounded, police said Wednesday.

title: Explained: What Is Tokenization And Why Is It Crypto's Next Big Thing?
content: Tokenization has long been a buzzword for crypto enthusiasts, who have been arguing for years that blockchain-based assets will change the underlying infrastructure of financial markets.

title: Delhi Records Cleanest July In A Decade, Air Quality At 67
content: Delhi recorded its cleanest July in ten years on Wednesday, with the city's average Air Quality Index (AQI) dropping to 67, according to data released by the Central Pollution Control Board. The reading falls in the 'Satisfactory' category.

title: Defence Secretary holds bilateral meeting with Director General of Israeli Ministry of Defence
content: The two sides agreed to work towards developing an institutional framework for further deepening of defence ties

title: DD Free Dish expands reach with greater representation of languages from southern States
content: Union Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting said DD Free Dish had experienced consistent growth in its reach over the past few years

title: Plea in SC seeks removal of MP Minister for ‘nauseating’ remarks against woman Army officer
content: In the May 19 SC hearing, Justice Kant had remarked that the Minister’s comments amounted to “crass, thoughtless remarks”. The court said there was no point apologising to the court merely to “wriggle out of a situation”

title: Fewer foreign trips, protocol lapses upset Dhankhar; former Vice President felt he had a diminished role
content: Differences over MEA assignments amongst reasons for the discord between the former Vice-President and government; Mr. Dhankhar felt his role was less than that of his predecessors, say sources

title: Kerala bids tearful farewell to V.S. Achuthanandan
content: Former Chief Minister and senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader V.S. Achuthanandan was cremated with full State honours at the Punnapra-Vayalar Martyrs’ Memorial at Valiya Chudukkad at 9.15 p.m., on the very soil that shaped his life and struggles

title: Telangana argues for restriction of diversion for KC Canal system by A.P.
content: Resuming final arguments before KWDT-II, counsel for TG urges Tribunal for telemetry at Banakacherla Cross Regulator too

title: Home Ministry begins moving out of British-era North Block
content: It is shifting to Common Central Secretariat building on Janpath; Once all offices move out of North and South Blocks, these will be turned into a museum

title: First exports from BBP: Four Asian elephants head to Japan
content: The exchange is a part of a larger multi exchange programme, where in return, the park will receive four cheetahs, four jaguars, four pumas, three chimpanzees and eight black-capped capuchins

title: Hole in one: Pinhole pupilloplasty emerges as alternative to corneal transplants
content: While a corneal transplant tries to address damage to the cornea, PPP tries to restore vision by tackling the pupil. In PPP, the size of the pupil is reduced surgically, to 1.5 mm, thus blocking peripheral vision and allowing focused central rays inside the eye, ensuring that the image is clear and without distortion

title: PM “shows weakness” by not responding to  Trump’s repeated claims on India-Pakistan conflict: Congress chief
content: In a sharp attack on the PM’s silence, Mr. Kharge asks, “Does Narendra Modi want to be subservient to Trump?”; Rahul Gandhi says “something is fishy” as PM has not responded to Mr. Trump’s claim of halting Operation Sindoor

title: Gait test conducted on accused in Kolkata law student gang-rape case
content: Court questions police inaction against prime accused despite multiple complaints; custody extended till August 5

title: GST: Small traders call off protest plan
content: Traders and shopkeepers have been told to mandatorily register under the GST to ensure prompt payment of taxes in the coming days

title: Delhi HC grants anticipatory bail to NewsClick founder in two separate cases, including one on foreign funding
content: The court also extended the relief to Prabir Purkayastha in a money laundering case being investigated by the Enforcement Directorate

title: Myntra, SIMPL under ED scanner for suspected FEMA breaches totalling ₹2,567 crore
content: According to ED, Myntra had declared that they engaged in wholesale cash and carry business, inviting and receiving funds from FDI to the tune of ₹ 1,654 crore

title: V.S. Achuthanandan’ s last journey draws thousands
content: The cortege took more than 22 hours to cover a distance of around 150 km from Thiruvananthapuram to Paravur, as thousands lined the route to pay their last respects.   Despite heavy downpour, a large number of people turned out to say adieu to their beloved leader

title: 3 T.N. women arrested in Idukki for attempt to sell 139 rose-ringed parakeets
content: They arrived early morning on Wednesday by bus from Pollachi in Tamil Nadu to Kattappana in Idukki carrying the birds hidden in cages

title: Tiruchi, Ariyalur police get ready for PM’s visit on July 27
content: Advanced Security Liaison meetings held in Tiruchi on Wednesday ahead of the VVIP’s visit to Gangaikondacholapuram in Ariyalur district

title: Munnar, Pengal Otrumai fondly remembers V.S. Achuthanandan
content: Workers from the tea plantations converge in Munnar town on July 23 to mourn the passing of their beloved leader

title: After 5 years, India to issue visas to Chinese tourists
content: The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs termed the decision a “positive move”; it, however, brushed aside concerns over the dam across the Yarlung Sangpo saying it was “fully within China’s sovereignty” and that it was cooperating with countries downstream

title: 15 lakh Bihar voters yet to submit forms, says Election Commission
content: Deadline to submit enumeration forms for the SIR on July 25; one lakh voters remain untraceable, says Election Commission; lists of ‘primarily incorrectly included electors’ shared with booth-level agents, it says

title: DYFI demands rollback of ticket price hike for Hari Hara Veera Mallu
content: They term it outrageous to charge ₹700 to ₹1,000 for benefit shows held a day before the film’s official release

title: Man, son brutally hacked to death in Bapatla district
content: The deceased, residents of Channasandra in Karnataka, were found murdered at a real estate venture near Pathamaguluru village; police suspect a premeditated attack, investigation underway

title: Integration of labour, industrial and national interest is a challenge in age of technological transformation, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: Speaking at an event on the 70th anniversary of Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), Mr. Bhagwat says equality among the workforce will not be achieved until people rise above the interests of their own families

title: Alnavar, Annigeri taluk hospitals to be upgraded with 30 beds
content: The government hospitals in the two taluks of Dharwad district will be made community health centres, says Health Minister

title: Heavy security in place in Thrissur for Karkidaka Vavu Bali ceremonies
content: Over 500 police personnel deployed across 87 locations; scuba diving and rescue teams, ambulances, and emergency response units will be stationed at all major venues

title: Tamil Nadu government officials acting like DMK’s propaganda secretaries, says BJP leader
content: Taking a dig at the DMK for involving government officials in Ungaludan Stalin programme, Nainar Nagenthran says the DMK is expanding itself at the cost of taxpayer’s money

title: Man gets life sentence for sexual assault of minor boy in Irinjalakuda
content: 63-year-old convict imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh and sentenced to an additional 13 years of imprisonment

title: IndiGo's Ahmedabad-Diu flight aborts take-off due to technical snag
content: The aircraft was in the take-off roll phase when the pilot decided to stop it on the runway; All the 50-odd passengers and crew members are safe, airlines says

title: IND vs ENG Test: Latest update on Pant's foot injury after being forced to retire hurt - details
content: Rishabh Pant's injury on Day 1 at Old Trafford marked a concerning moment for the visitors as he retired hurt after a blow to his foot. Pant's injury occurred while attempting a reverse sweep, adding to India's woes after a strong start was undone by quick dismissals of key players. He was taken for scans, casting doubt on his further participation in the Test.

title: Al-Qaida terror module busted: Guj ATS arrests 4 operatives, seizes documents on Op Sindoor
content: Gujarat ATS arrested four individuals from Ahmedabad, Delhi, Noida, and Modasa for alleged links to Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent (AQIS). They are accused of propagating AQIS ideology, promoting radicalization, and recruitment through social media. Authorities seized incriminating materials, including pro-Pakistani content and documents related to 'Operation Sindoor,' during the operation.

title: Dhankhars pack up, set to vacate Vice-President Enclave; to be allotted another bungalow
content: Just fifteen months after moving into the newly constructed Vice President's Enclave, Jagdeep Dhankhar is preparing to relocate. His resignation, tendered due to health concerns, has triggered the process of vacating the premises. Dhankhar is expected to transition into a Type VIII government bungalow in Lutyens’ Delhi, typically reserved for top Union ministers.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant a huge blow as India ride the ebbs and flows on Day 1; 264/4 at stumps
content: Rishabh Pant's injury after a blow to his foot marred India's progress on Day 1 against England as they reached 264/4 at stumps. Pant's pain and subsequent retired hurt disrupted a promising partnership with Sai Sudharsan who struck his maiden Test fifty. Earlier, India had a solid start, but quick wickets gave away the momentum.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China' diktat to employees
content: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has restricted employee device usage in China due to rising US-China tensions. Staff must now use temporary phones and cannot use company laptops. This policy enhancement, effective July 16, reflects growing corporate anxiety after incidents involving Western executives being prevented from leaving China.

title: New video shows receptionist slapped man's relative before being attacked - Video
content: A violent incident at a Kalyan paediatric clinic took a new turn after CCTV footage revealed that the receptionist had slapped a woman before being assaulted by her relative, Gokul Jha. Earlier, a viral video showed Jha kicking and dragging the receptionist. He was later arrested, and the case sparked political protests and public outrage.

title: Christian Michel’s children write to PM; seek their father's release
content: The children of Christian Michel, accused in the AgustaWestland scam, have appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his unconditional release. Michel has been in Tihar jail for seven years without a trial. His son highlights this as a human rights violation. His children also wrote to UK PM Keir Starmer, claiming illegal detention and double jeopardy.

title: Britain makes a profit on the ‘aid’ it gives to India for first time
content: For the first time since 1947, Britain has profited from its aid to India. A recent report reveals a profit of over £12 million for 2024-2025. The UK will spend over £24 million on aid to India for 2025-2026. This marks a shift from financial aid to business investments.

title: 'Apologies' from Astronomer ex-CEO caught in Coldplay 'Kiss Cam' scandal go viral
content: Former Astronomer CEO Andy Byron's 'Kiss Cam' incident with HR Head Kristin Cabot at a Coldplay concert has exploded online, prompting a wave of fake apologies. Astronomer has confirmed that statements attributed to Byron and even Coldplay are hoaxes. Ry Walker, Astronomer’s former CEO, also dismissed one statement as fake. The company has initiated a formal investigation into the matter.

title: Security tightened for Kashmir University alumni meet; top SC judges to attend
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police convened a high-level meeting to fortify security measures for the University of Kashmir's upcoming alumni meet. Chief Justice of India Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai, Supreme Court judges Surya Kant and Vikram Nath, Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju, and J&K LG Manoj Sinha are expected to attend the event on July 27.

title: Air India crash families in UK have ‘received the wrong bodies’, say lawyers
content: Families of British victims of the Air India 171 crash have allegedly received incorrect or mixed remains, causing immense distress. Lawyers are demanding answers and accountability from both Indian and British authorities regarding the flawed identification and repatriation process. The United Kingdom government is investigating, and families are seeking intervention from Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: ‘10% is the new zero tariff’: Trump seals trade deals with many countries - what do they mean for India?
content: Donald Trump's trade deals signal a new normal with base tariffs around 10-20%, impacting nations like Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines, and Japan. An India-US trade deal remains elusive due to disagreements on agriculture and dairy, with potential tariffs expected to be above 10%.

title: Who is Bryan Johnson: Anti-aging champion who spent $2 million on age-reversing
content: Bryan Johnson, the tech entrepreneur known for his anti-aging pursuits, is discontinuing his age-reversal startup, Blueprint, citing financial losses and a desire to concentrate on his philosophical movement, "Don't Die." Johnson, famous for his intense health regimen, aims to fully dedicate himself to this new mission, viewing commercial ventures as distractions from his goal of reshaping humanity's relationship with death.

title: Divya in tears after becoming first Indian to reach WC final - Watch
content: India's Divya Deshmukh made history. She beat former world champion Tan Zhongyi. Divya secured a spot in the FIDE Women’s World Cup final. Koneru Humpy faces a tie-break. She drew with Lei Tingjie. The tournament highlights Asia's strength in women's chess. An Indian will play in the next Women’s Candidates Tournament. Fans hope for an all-Indian final.

title: ‘Stop saving Fake $’: Rich Dad author Robert Kiyosaki warns of ‘biggest crash in history’
content: Robert Kiyosaki is again sounding the alarm about the global financial system, urging investors to ditch fiat currencies for gold, silver, and Bitcoin. He criticizes the Federal Reserve's money-printing responses to crises, warning that the US is nearing a historic economic collapse. Kiyosaki advises saving in real assets, believing savers are losers in the current system.

title: ‘The only right answer is…’: Bill Gates on daughter’s unexpected ask
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle opens up about choosing surrogacy
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Connor’s next team decided? One Stanley Cup contender has the edge
content: Speculation surrounds Connor McDavid's future with the Edmonton Oilers as contract extension talks remain stalled. NHL insider Chris Johnston suggests that while Edmonton is still the frontrunner, teams with ample cap space and a clear path to championship contention could lure the NHL superstar if he explores free agency in 2026.

title: Travis Kelce calls his romance with Taylor Swift a ‘Pretty Woman’ swap
content: Travis Kelce humorously likened his relationship with Taylor Swift to a reversed *Pretty Woman* scenario on the New Heights podcast. He joked about Swift being the wealthy benefactor and himself as the one out of his depth. Kelce playfully embraced the comparison, even referring to himself as an "NFL hooker," highlighting the couple's lighthearted dynamic and affection.

title: Epstein fallout: Trump invokes 'favourite saviour' - Obama. Will MAGA buy it?
content: Donald Trump faces heat over Jeffrey Epstein links. He accuses Barack Obama of treason to deflect attention. However, this tactic seems less effective now. MAGA supporters demand more disclosures. The Epstein scandal divides Trump's base. Some Republicans use the issue against Trump. His grip on MAGA weakens. The old playbook may not work this time.

title: '100 khoon maaf karne ke liye': Revanth Reddy bats for VP from Telangana
content: Telangana's chief minister, Revanth Reddy, has urged for a leader from Telangana to be chosen as the next Vice President, following Jagdeep Dhankhar's unexpected resignation. He strongly advocated for Bandaru Dattatreya, highlighting his OBC background and past political marginalization by the NDA. Reddy criticised the NDA for allegedly downgrading OBC leaders in South India, particularly in Telangana.

title: Watch: Pant taken off on mobile ambulance at Old Trafford after bloody foot injury
content: Rishabh Pant's injury woes deepened on Day 1 of the 4th Test as he retired hurt after a painful blow to his right foot. Pant, who scored a quick 37, was struck by a Chris Woakes delivery while attempting a reverse sweep. Despite surviving an LBW review, the impact caused visible swelling and discomfort, forcing him off the field.

title: Fake stamps, diplomatic license plates: How a man ran fake embassy for 'West Arctica' from Ghaziabad
content: In Ghaziabad, a man named Harsh Vardhan Jain was arrested for operating a fake embassy from a rented house. Posing as a diplomat from the fictitious nation of "West Arctica," he allegedly defrauded individuals and businesses with promises of overseas jobs. Jain enhanced his credibility using doctored images with prominent Indian leaders and fake diplomatic plates.

title: IND U19 vs ENG U19: Suryavanshi hits not-seen-before low - Watch
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the young IPL sensation, faced a setback with a golden duck in the Youth Test against England U-19. India, chasing a challenging 355, found hope in skipper Ayush Mhatre's explosive counterattack, smashing a rapid century. Mhatre's heroics, along with support from Vihaan Malhotra and Abhigyan Kundu, propelled India's chase, leaving them with 128 runs to win.

title: Tobacco companies are now using NFTs for promoting rising vaping risk
content: Tobacco companies are exploiting the metaverse to promote smoking and vaping among young people, bypassing traditional advertising restrictions. Researchers have found virtual reality platforms and gaming communities are being used to normalize these harmful behaviors. Experts warn this unregulated digital marketing could reverse progress in tobacco control, urging countries to expand policies to include online channels.

title: 'Had strong pro-China stance': Ex-President Nasheed on India-Maldives ties
content: Former Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed affirmed the nation's commitment to an "India-first foreign policy," highlighting past fluctuations between pro-China and pro-India stances. He lauded India's crucial economic assistance, which prevented a default, and anticipates Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit will boost tourism. Modi's visit occurs amidst improving relations following a diplomatic row earlier in 2024.

title: Record! Pant achieves milestone Dhoni, Gilchrist, Boucher couldn't - more inside
content: Rishabh Pant achieves a milestone. He is the first visiting wicketkeeper to score 1,000 Test runs in England. He reached the landmark during the 4th Test against England at Old Trafford. Pant surpassed MS Dhoni's previous record. His unbeaten innings has provided stability to India. India stands at 197/3. Cricket fans and experts are praising Pant's achievement.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Worse than Karun Nair's last Test leave': Gill trolled for lbw dismissal
content: Shubman Gill's dismissal on Day 1 of the 4th Test against England drew criticism, reminiscent of Karun Nair's past error in the last Test match. Gill's misjudgement against Ben Stokes led to an LBW, resulting in a score of 12. Despite this setback, India concluded the day at 149/3, with Jaiswal and Rahul contributing solid scores.

title: CBSE warns schools: No more than 45 students per section—no exceptions
content: CBSE has announced that affiliated schools can now register up to 45 students per section under exceptional circumstances, as outlined in Circular No. 11/2025. This decision addresses challenges in accommodating students, especially transfers, and builds upon previous relaxations introduced in August 2023 and May 2024. Schools must document reasons and ensure adequate classroom sizes.

title: IND vs ENG: After nearly 3,000 days, Dawson returns to Tests in style - Watch
content: Liam Dawson marked a sensational Test return after 2,928 days, immediately impacting the India vs England series by claiming Yashasvi Jaiswal as his first wicket in eight years. His beautifully flighted delivery showcased his evolved bowling skills, earning praise from Ravichandran Ashwin. Dawson's comeback adds depth to England's attack, reigniting their fight and inspiring fans with his perseverance.

title: ‘You can’t change colours’: Indian student attacked in racist assault in Australia
content: An Indian international student, Charanpreet Singh, was brutally assaulted in Adelaide, with the attack being investigated as potentially racially motivated. Singh and his wife were allegedly ambushed by a group of men who shouted racial slurs before inflicting serious injuries. The incident has sparked outrage and renewed calls for enhanced safety measures for international students in the area.

title: Travis Kelce watches as Jason goes shirtless in front of Taylor Swift during NFL game
content: Jason Kelce, the former Philadelphia Eagles center, had a memorable day at a Kansas City Chiefs playoff game. He was there to support his brother, Travis Kelce. Jason met pop star Taylor Swift in Travis's suite. He got so excited that he took his shirt off and jumped into the stands.

title: Electronics exports: India challenges China’s dominance, eyes leadership in manufacturing
content: India is poised to become a major electronics manufacturing hub, challenging China and Vietnam, according to a Centre for Development Studies report. The Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme spurred a massive increase in mobile phone exports, reaching $24.1 billion in 2024-25. Domestic Value Addition also rose significantly, creating numerous jobs.

title: 'I married Ishita, but she was Afreen': UP man alleges forced conversion bid by Chhangur Baba
content: Jyotirgmay Rai accused Chhangur Baba, also known as Jamaluddin, of brainwashing him and threatening to kill his two daughters to force his conversion to Islam. Rai alleges that after marrying a Muslim woman and having children, he faced immense pressure to convert, including threats involving his daughters. Police are investigating the claims following Rai's complaint.

title: Ozzy Osbourne (1948–2025) – the bat-biting godfather of metal signs off in style
content: Ozzy Osbourne, the Prince of Darkness, lived louder than the amplifiers he fronted. From Birmingham’s grimy streets, he forged heavy metal with Black Sabbath’s doom-laden riffs, reshaping rock forever. His voice – raw, haunted, unforgettable – became the soundtrack of rebellion and existential dread. Offstage, he was chaos incarnate: biting bats, snorting ants, and turning scandal into legend. Fired by Sabbath, he returned with Crazy Train, proving he was both survivor and showman. His final concert at Villa Park, days before his death at 76, was a thunderous farewell. Ozzy didn’t just live rock ‘n’ roll – he weaponised it.

title: ‘Hurts Islamic sentiments’: BJP slams Dimple Yadav’s attire at mosque; Akhilesh fires back
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for conducting a party meeting inside a mosque on Parliament Street, alleging that Dimple Yadav's attire violated mosque norms and hurt Islamic sentiments. Dimple Yadav refuted the claims, accusing the BJP of misleading the public, while Akhilesh Yadav slammed the BJP for using religion as a divisive tool.

title: Bihar voter list revision: 20L deceased, over 7L duplicate voters - EC gives update on SIR
content: The Election Commission's intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls has covered 98.01% of voters, identifying deceased, migrated, and duplicate entries. This cleanup, the first in 22 years, aims to ensure a pure and accurate voter list. The Supreme Court and opposition parties are scrutinising the exercise, while the EC defends its legality and limited use of identity documents.

title: 'Can't express ...': How Kamboj spent his last 48 hours before India Test debut - Watch
content: Anshul Kamboj, Haryana's seamer, debuts for India in the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford. He receives his cap from Deep Dasgupta. Kamboj expresses his feelings as unreal. He aims to perform his best. Kamboj's inclusion follows impressive performances for India A. He shares a connection with Anil Kumble, who debuted in Manchester in 1990.

title: IndiGo Ahmedabad-Diu flight aborts take-off; engine fire warning issued
content: An IndiGo ATR flight 6E-7966, en route from Ahmedabad to Diu, experienced an engine fire warning during takeoff on Wednesday, prompting the pilots to abort. The aircraft, carrying 70 passengers, halted safely, and all individuals on board are reported to be secure. The aircraft is currently grounded for thorough inspections, and the DGCA has initiated an investigation into the incident.

title: Watch: Jaiswal breaks bat in dramatic fashion! India reach lunch unscathed
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's bat handle dramatically snapped while facing Chris Woakes during the fourth Test's opening session at Old Trafford. Despite the equipment malfunction, the young opener remained composed, contributing to India's steady start. At lunch, India reached 78/0, with Jaiswal and KL Rahul blunting the English attack, frustrating the bowlers who struggled to find consistency under overcast conditions.

title: Michael Beasley shares heartwarming childhood pictures of his kids
content: Michael Beasley showcases his role as a loving father on Instagram. He shares heartwarming pictures of his children. Beasley co-founded WeThemOnes, a streetwear brand. The brand released an exclusive collection in February. Beasley also won a $100,000 challenge against Lance Stephenson. He addressed his basketball skills on a podcast. Beasley's net worth is $10 million.

title: ‘Aggressive US pressure can force…’: GTRI warns India against one-sided trade deal
content: The Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) warns India against replicating the US-Indonesia trade deal, which heavily favors the US by granting access to Indonesia's markets while imposing tariffs on Indonesian goods. GTRI advises India to be cautious in trade negotiations with the US, especially regarding agriculture, digital trade, and product standards.

title: Kranti Goud: Daughter of a MP police constable, who rocked England with 6/52
content: Kranti Goud, a 21-year-old pace sensation from a small village in Madhya Pradesh, delivered a match-winning performance for India, claiming 6 for 52 against England. Her journey from humble beginnings, supported by her coach Rajiv Bilthare and later Chandrakant Pandit, culminated in a series-clinching victory.

title: 👟 Clark surprises Iowa with Nike Kobe 5 Protros
content: WNBA star caitlin Clark surprised the Iowa Hawkeyes men's and women's basketball teams . she has consistently sported the Kobe Bryant signature shoe since her college days at Iowa . "it's not eve," she said last season .

title: Ranking best deadline rentals: CC Sabathia on Brewers? JD Martinez with D-backs?
content: the third baseman for the Arizona Diamondbacks is now challenging Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge for the major league lead in home runs . if they do, Suarez could become one of the more impactful trade-deadline acquisitions we've seen . only five players have ever been traded in the middle of a 40-year period .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 training camps: Chiefs see instant Mahomes-Rice connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND .

title: One month until college football: Swing games for every Top 25 team
content: a month away from college football, we asked our reporters to single out one contest for each of our post-spring Top 25 teams that could swing their season one way or the other . some will come in major nonconference battles over the first couple of weeks, some are more traditional league games that could set the tone for the things to come .

title: Dynasty rankings: Top 300 players for 2025 and beyond
content: my points-league rankings for 2025 are for fantasy managers in dynasty/keeper leagues who are looking ahead to the winter roster cut-down . in this space, I rank players for the next five-plus seasons, serving as an effective price guide . this space uses the following player valuation formula: Rest-of-2025 performance: 10% . 2027 performance: 22.5%. 2028 performance: 22,5% .

title: 'I felt like I needed to smoke a cigarette sometimes': Untold stories from NFL holdouts
content: future Hall of Fame offensive tackle Walter Jones spotted something in a newspaper that changed everything about his holdout in 2002 . he was trying to secure a long-term deal from the Seattle Seahawks . but he read something that compelled him to sign a deal that same day: the amount of money he had forfeited .

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day
content: numbers can tell us compelling stories, but they can mislead, usually when framed in a way to construct a narrative or support a specific claim . the numbers determine our teams' fates, and they have a massive say in our draft day, waiver wire and weekly lineup processes . as you prepare for the 2025 fantasy football season, .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs enter Rodrygo race
content: real madrid are interested in signing manchester city midfielder Rodri . despite his recent long-term injury, the 29-year-old has recovered from a serious knee injury . the spaniard is set to enter the final year of his contract in 2026 .

title: MLS All-Star Game history: All-time matchups, MVPs, stats
content: the MLS All-Star Game has become a favorite annual showcase for soccer fans . each year, a group of players will face off against an international club or another league . MLS is 10-10 against international competition in the game's history .

title: EA College Football 26 review roundup: Improvement on all fronts
content: this year's iteration of the series stands at 83 on Metacritic based on 13 reviews on PS5 . the Xbox Series X|S version is noticeably less well regarded with 79 Metascore . opencritic lists CFB 26 with an average top critic score of 84 across platforms .

title: Spain finally have all of Barcelona's midfield stars in top form together
content: the signs at euro 2025 suggest it's finally changing . it will be put to the test on Wednesday against Germany in Zurich . a first-ever win over a german side beat them in last year's bronze medal match at the Olympic Games .

title: Zubimendi joined Arsenal after rejecting Liverpool. Can he end their title wait?
content: arsenal manager Mikel Arteta believes new signing Martn Zubimendi joins the club . the club's away kit launch on Monday took place at NOVA Rooftop in Singapore . it is the only tangible improvement they can make after three consecutive second-place finishes in the premier league .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in . petitioners point out that a station at Bettahalasur cross is essential .

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5
content: 11 five-star prospects have declared, including two recent commits . the longhorns are making themselves comfortable within SEC country . they landed running back Derrick Cooper, a one-time Georgia commit . Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .
